message.content: aggiorna nel README.md la data di ultima modifica alla fine a August 2025, poi committa e fai push

content.content:
1â†’# Claude Code Configuration Repository
     2â†’
     3â†’> ğŸ¤– **Advanced Claude Code configuration with intelligent agent orchestration, Context7 integration, and AI-driven development workflows**
     4â†’
     5â†’## ğŸ“‹ Table of Contents
     6â†’
     7â†’- [Overview](#overview)
     8â†’- [Features](#features)
     9â†’- [Quick Start](#quick-start)
    10â†’- [Configuration Structure](#configuration-structure)
    11â†’- [Agent System](#agent-system)
    12â†’- [Context7 Integration](#context7-integration)
    13â†’- [Commands & Workflows](#commands--workflows)
    14â†’- [Advanced Features](#advanced-features)
    15â†’- [Installation](#installation)
    16â†’- [Contributing](#contributing)
    17â†’
    18â†’## ğŸ¯ Overview
    19â†’
    20â†’This repository contains a comprehensive Claude Code configuration designed for full-stack development with intelligent multi-agent orchestration. It includes automated task analysis, smart model selection, and integration with Context7 for real-time documentation access.
    21â†’
    22â†’### Key Capabilities
    23â†’
    24â†’- **ğŸ§  Intelligent Agent Orchestration**: 100+ specialized agents for every development need
    25â†’- **ğŸ“š Context7 MCP Integration**: Real-time documentation for any library
    26â†’- **ğŸ”„ Adaptive Model Selection**: Automatic selection between Haiku, Sonnet, and Opus
    27â†’- **ğŸ“Š Learning System**: Continuous improvement from usage patterns
    28â†’- **ğŸš€ Modern Stack Support**: Laravel, React, Next.js, TypeScript, Docker, and more
    29â†’
    30â†’## âœ¨ Features
    31â†’
    32â†’### Core Features
    33â†’
    34â†’1. **Multi-Agent System**
    35â†’   - Backend specialists (Laravel, PHP, TypeScript, Python)
    36â†’   - Frontend experts (React, Vue, Next.js)
    37â†’   - DevOps engineers (Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform)
    38â†’   - Security auditors and penetration testers
    39â†’   - AI/ML engineers
    40â†’
    41â†’2. **Intelligent Orchestration**
    42â†’   - Automatic task complexity analysis
    43â†’   - Smart agent selection based on domain
    44â†’   - Parallel and sequential execution patterns
    45â†’   - Inter-agent communication protocols
    46â†’
    47â†’3. **Context7 Integration**
    48â†’   - Real-time library documentation
    49â†’   - Version-specific information
    50â†’   - Smart library resolution
    51â†’   - Optimized token usage
    52â†’
    53â†’4. **Advanced Workflows**
    54â†’   - Full-stack feature development
    55â†’   - Performance optimization
    56â†’   - Security auditing
    57â†’   - Deployment automation
    58â†’
    59â†’## ğŸš€ Quick Start
    60â†’
    61â†’### 1. Clone the Repository
    62â†’
    63â†’```bash
    64â†’git clone https://github.com/lushanoperera/claude-code.git
    65â†’cd claude-code
    66â†’```
    67â†’
    68â†’### 2. Setup Environment
    69â†’
    70â†’```bash
    71â†’# Copy example environment file
    72â†’cp .env.example .env
    73â†’
    74â†’# Edit .env with your credentials
    75â†’nano .env
    76â†’```
    77â†’
    78â†’### 3. Install Configuration
    79â†’
    80â†’```bash
    81â†’# Copy CLAUDE.md to your Claude directory
    82â†’cp CLAUDE.md ~/.claude/CLAUDE.md
    83â†’
    84â†’# Optional: Copy additional configurations
    85â†’cp -r agents/ ~/.claude/agents/
    86â†’cp -r templates/ ~/.claude/templates/
    87â†’```
    88â†’
    89â†’### 4. Verify Installation
    90â†’
    91â†’```bash
    92â†’# Test Claude Code with a simple command
    93â†’claude "Hello, test the configuration"
    94â†’```
    95â†’
    96â†’## ğŸ“ Configuration Structure
    97â†’
    98â†’```
    99â†’claude-code-config/
   100â†’â”œâ”€â”€ CLAUDE.md                 # Main configuration file
   101â†’â”œâ”€â”€ agents.md                 # Complete agent catalog
   102â†’â”œâ”€â”€ context7-integration.md   # Context7 MCP documentation
   103â†’â”œâ”€â”€ workflows/               # Workflow templates
   104â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ feature-development.yaml
   105â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ performance-optimization.yaml
   106â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ security-audit.yaml
   107â†’â”œâ”€â”€ templates/              # Code templates
   108â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ laravel/
   109â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ react/
   110â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ docker/
   111â†’â””â”€â”€ scripts/               # Utility scripts
   112â†’    â”œâ”€â”€ setup.sh
   113â†’    â””â”€â”€ test-config.sh
   114â†’```
   115â†’
   116â†’## ğŸ¤– Agent System
   117â†’
   118â†’### Available Agent Categories
   119â†’
   120â†’#### Backend Development
   121â†’- `laravel-specialist` - Laravel 10+ expert
   122â†’- `php-pro` - Modern PHP 8.3+
   123â†’- `backend-typescript-architect` - TypeScript with Bun
   124â†’- `python-backend-engineer` - Python with uv tooling
   125â†’
   126â†’#### Frontend Development
   127â†’- `ui-engineer` - UI/UX implementation
   128â†’- `react-specialist` - React 18+ with modern patterns
   129â†’- `nextjs-developer` - Next.js 14+ with App Router
   130â†’- `vue-expert` - Vue 3 Composition API
   131â†’
   132â†’#### Full Stack
   133â†’- `fullstack-developer` - End-to-end features
   134â†’- `wordpress-expert` - WordPress customization
   135â†’
   136â†’#### DevOps & Infrastructure
   137â†’- `docker-specialist` - Containerization expert
   138â†’- `kubernetes-specialist` - K8s orchestration
   139â†’- `terraform-engineer` - Infrastructure as Code
   140â†’- `devops-engineer` - CI/CD and automation
   141â†’
   142â†’#### Security
   143â†’- `security-engineer` - DevSecOps practices
   144â†’- `penetration-tester` - Ethical hacking
   145â†’- `security-auditor` - Compliance and audits
   146â†’
   147â†’### Agent Selection Examples
   148â†’
   149â†’```yaml
   150â†’# Simple task - Single agent
   151â†’Task: "Add email validation"
   152â†’Agent: php-pro
   153â†’Model: Haiku
   154â†’
   155â†’# Medium complexity - Multiple agents
   156â†’Task: "Implement authentication system"
   157â†’Agents: [laravel-specialist, security-engineer]
   158â†’Model: Sonnet
   159â†’
   160â†’# Complex task - Orchestration
   161â†’Task: "Build e-commerce platform"
   162â†’Agents: [fullstack-developer, laravel-specialist, react-specialist, payment-integration]
   163â†’Model: Opus
   164â†’```
   165â†’
   166â†’## ğŸ”Œ Context7 Integration
   167â†’
   168â†’### Configuration
   169â†’
   170â†’```yaml
   171â†’endpoint: https://mcp.context7.com/mcp
   172â†’priority: primary_documentation_source
   173â†’```
   174â†’
   175â†’### Usage Examples
   176â†’
   177â†’```typescript
   178â†’// Resolve library ID
   179â†’resolve-library-id("react")
   180â†’// Returns: /facebook/react
   181â†’
   182â†’// Get documentation
   183â†’get-library-docs("/facebook/react", {
   184â†’  tokens: 10000,
   185â†’  topic: "hooks"
   186â†’})
   187â†’```
   188â†’
   189â†’### Supported Libraries
   190â†’
   191â†’- **Frontend**: React, Vue, Angular, Svelte, Next.js
   192â†’- **Backend**: Laravel, Express, NestJS, Django
   193â†’- **Databases**: MongoDB, PostgreSQL, MySQL
   194â†’- **Cloud**: AWS, Firebase, Supabase, Vercel
   195â†’
   196â†’## ğŸ“ Commands & Workflows
   197â†’
   198â†’### Quick Commands
   199â†’
   200â†’```bash
   201â†’# Agent selection
   202â†’/agent laravel              # Activate Laravel specialist
   203â†’/agent fullstack            # Activate full-stack developer
   204â†’/orchestrate complex        # Start multi-agent orchestration
   205â†’
   206â†’# Templates
   207â†’/template feature           # Feature development template
   208â†’/template optimize          # Performance optimization
   209â†’/template security          # Security audit
   210â†’
   211â†’# Context management
   212â†’/context save project_name  # Save project context
   213â†’/context load project_name  # Load project context
   214â†’
   215â†’# Learning & optimization
   216â†’/learn analyze             # Analyze patterns
   217â†’/optimize suggest          # Get optimization suggestions
   218â†’```
   219â†’
   220â†’### Workflow Templates
   221â†’
   222â†’#### Feature Development
   223â†’```yaml
   224â†’name: full-stack-feature-development
   225â†’phases:
   226â†’  1. Requirements analysis
   227â†’  2. Backend API development
   228â†’  3. Frontend implementation
   229â†’  4. Integration testing
   230â†’  5. Security review
   231â†’```
   232â†’
   233â†’#### Performance Optimization
   234â†’```yaml
   235â†’name: performance-optimization
   236â†’phases:
   237â†’  1. Performance profiling
   238â†’  2. Database optimization
   239â†’  3. Backend optimization
   240â†’  4. Frontend optimization
   241â†’  5. Infrastructure tuning
   242â†’```
   243â†’
   244â†’## ğŸš€ Advanced Features
   245â†’
   246â†’### 1. Intelligent Model Selection
   247â†’
   248â†’```typescript
   249â†’interface ModelSelection {
   250â†’  simple_tasks: 'haiku'        // 1-3 operations
   251â†’  medium_tasks: 'sonnet'       // 4-7 operations
   252â†’  complex_tasks: 'opus'        // 8+ operations
   253â†’  critical_architecture: 'opus' // Always Opus
   254â†’}
   255â†’```
   256â†’
   257â†’### 2. Learning System
   258â†’
   259â†’The configuration includes an adaptive learning system that:
   260â†’- Tracks success patterns
   261â†’- Optimizes agent selection
   262â†’- Improves over time
   263â†’- Generates insights
   264â†’
   265â†’### 3. Multi-Agent Orchestration
   266â†’
   267â†’```typescript
   268â†’// Parallel execution
   269â†’const results = await Promise.all([
   270â†’  agent1.execute(),
   271â†’  agent2.execute(),
   272â†’  agent3.execute()
   273â†’])
   274â†’
   275â†’// Sequential pipeline
   276â†’const pipeline = agent1
   277â†’  .then(agent2)
   278â†’  .then(agent3)
   279â†’  .execute()
   280â†’```
   281â†’
   282â†’### 4. Context Persistence
   283â†’
   284â†’```json
   285â†’{
   286â†’  "project_context": {
   287â†’    "tech_stack": ["Laravel", "React", "MySQL"],
   288â†’    "architecture": "microservices",
   289â†’    "deployment": "kubernetes",
   290â†’    "team_size": 5
   291â†’  }
   292â†’}
   293â†’```
   294â†’
   295â†’## ğŸ“¦ Installation
   296â†’
   297â†’### Prerequisites
   298â†’
   299â†’- Claude Code CLI installed
   300â†’- Git for version control
   301â†’- Text editor for configuration
   302â†’
   303â†’### Step-by-Step Installation
   304â†’
   305â†’1. **Clone Repository**
   306â†’   ```bash
   307â†’   git clone https://github.com/lushanoperera/claude-code.git
   308â†’   ```
   309â†’
   310â†’2. **Configure Environment**
   311â†’   ```bash
   312â†’   cp .env.example .env
   313â†’   # Add your credentials to .env
   314â†’   ```
   315â†’
   316â†’3. **Install Configuration**
   317â†’   ```bash
   318â†’   # Linux/Mac
   319â†’   ./scripts/setup.sh
   320â†’   
   321â†’   # Windows
   322â†’   scripts\setup.bat
   323â†’   ```
   324â†’
   325â†’4. **Verify Setup**
   326â†’   ```bash
   327â†’   ./scripts/test-config.sh
   328â†’   ```
   329â†’
   330â†’### Directory Structure After Installation
   331â†’
   332â†’```
   333â†’~/.claude/
   334â†’â”œâ”€â”€ CLAUDE.md                  # Main configuration
   335â†’â”œâ”€â”€ agents/                    # Agent specifications
   336â†’â”œâ”€â”€ context/                   # Context persistence
   337â†’â”œâ”€â”€ learning/                  # Learning data
   338â†’â”œâ”€â”€ templates/                 # Code templates
   339â†’â””â”€â”€ integrations/             # Service integrations
   340â†’```
   341â†’
   342â†’## ğŸ› ï¸ Customization
   343â†’
   344â†’### Adding Custom Agents
   345â†’
   346â†’```yaml
   347â†’# agents/custom-agent.yaml
   348â†’name: custom-specialist
   349â†’expertise: "Your domain expertise"
   350â†’tools: [tool1, tool2]
   351â†’use_cases:
   352â†’  - "Specific use case 1"
   353â†’  - "Specific use case 2"
   354â†’```
   355â†’
   356â†’### Creating Workflow Templates
   357â†’
   358â†’```yaml
   359â†’# workflows/custom-workflow.yaml
   360â†’name: custom-workflow
   361â†’trigger: "pattern or command"
   362â†’phases:
   363â†’  - agent: specialist1
   364â†’    tasks: [task1, task2]
   365â†’  - agent: specialist2
   366â†’    tasks: [task3, task4]
   367â†’```
   368â†’
   369â†’### Modifying Model Selection
   370â†’
   371â†’```typescript
   372â†’// Adjust complexity thresholds
   373â†’const complexityThresholds = {
   374â†’  simple: 3,    // Operations count
   375â†’  medium: 7,    // Operations count
   376â†’  complex: 10   // Operations count
   377â†’}
   378â†’```
   379â†’
   380â†’## ğŸ“Š Metrics & Monitoring
   381â†’
   382â†’### Tracked Metrics
   383â†’
   384â†’- **Task Success Rate**: Completion percentage
   385â†’- **Agent Performance**: Individual agent effectiveness
   386â†’- **Model Accuracy**: Model selection accuracy
   387â†’- **Time to Completion**: Average task duration
   388â†’- **Cost Efficiency**: Token usage optimization
   389â†’
   390â†’### Performance Dashboard
   391â†’
   392â†’```bash
   393â†’# View performance metrics
   394â†’/dashboard show
   395â†’
   396â†’# Get detailed analytics
   397â†’/metrics summary
   398â†’
   399â†’# Check system health
   400â†’/health check
   401â†’```
   402â†’
   403â†’## ğŸ”’ Security Considerations
   404â†’
   405â†’### Environment Variables
   406â†’
   407â†’Never commit sensitive data. Use `.env` for:
   408â†’- API keys
   409â†’- Access tokens
   410â†’- Personal information
   411â†’- Service credentials
   412â†’
   413â†’### Best Practices
   414â†’
   415â†’1. Regular credential rotation
   416â†’2. Use environment-specific configs
   417â†’3. Implement access controls
   418â†’4. Audit agent permissions
   419â†’5. Monitor unusual activity
   420â†’
   421â†’## ğŸ¤ Contributing
   422â†’
   423â†’We welcome contributions! Please see our [Contributing Guide](CONTRIBUTING.md) for details.
   424â†’
   425â†’### How to Contribute
   426â†’
   427â†’1. Fork the repository
   428â†’2. Create a feature branch
   429â†’3. Make your changes
   430â†’4. Test thoroughly
   431â†’5. Submit a pull request
   432â†’
   433â†’### Areas for Contribution
   434â†’
   435â†’- New agent specifications
   436â†’- Workflow templates
   437â†’- Integration improvements
   438â†’- Documentation updates
   439â†’- Performance optimizations
   440â†’
   441â†’## ğŸ“„ License
   442â†’
   443â†’This project is licensed under the MIT License - see the [LICENSE](LICENSE) file for details.
   444â†’
   445â†’
   446â†’This configuration builds upon excellent work from the open-source community:
   447â†’
   448â†’### ğŸ¤– Agent Sources & Inspirations
   449â†’- **[Agent OS](https://github.com/buildermethods/agent-os)** - Core orchestration patterns and multi-agent coordination
   450â†’- **[Awesome Claude Code Agents](https://github.com/hesreallyhim/awesome-claude-code-agents)** - Curated agent collection and specializations  
   451â†’- **[Agents Repository](https://github.com/wshobson/agents)** - Agent definitions and development patterns
   452â†’
   453â†’### ğŸ› ï¸ Platform & Integration
   454â†’- **[Anthropic](https://anthropic.com)** - Claude and Claude Code platform
   455â†’- **[Context7](https://context7.com)** - MCP integration for real-time documentation
   456â†’- **[MCP Protocol](https://modelcontextprotocol.io)** - Model Context Protocol specifications
   457â†’
   458â†’### ğŸ’¡ Our Contributions
   459â†’Building on these foundations, we've added:
   460â†’- Intelligent agent orchestration with automatic model selection
   461â†’- Bidirectional sync between Claude config and Git repository
   462â†’- Advanced Context7 MCP integration with caching
   463â†’- Comprehensive workflow templates and automation
   464â†’- Developer experience enhancements with quick setup
   465â†’
   466â†’See [CREDITS.md](CREDITS.md) for detailed attributions and licensing information.
   467â†’
   468â†’## ğŸ“ Support
   469â†’
   470â†’- **Issues**: [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/lushanoperera/claude-code/issues)
   471â†’- **Discussions**: [GitHub Discussions](https://github.com/lushanoperera/claude-code/discussions)
   472â†’- **Documentation**: [Wiki](https://github.com/lushanoperera/claude-code/wiki)
   473â†’
   474â†’## ğŸ”„ Version History
   475â†’
   476â†’- **v3.0** (2025-01-12): Current version with 100+ agents
   477â†’- **v2.0**: Added Context7 integration
   478â†’- **v1.0**: Initial release
   479â†’
   480â†’---
   481â†’
   482â†’**Built with â¤ï¸ for the Claude Code community**
   483â†’
   484â†’*Last Updated: January 2025*

file.content:
# Claude Code Configuration Repository

> ğŸ¤– **Advanced Claude Code configuration with intelligent agent orchestration, Context7 integration, and AI-driven development workflows**

## ğŸ“‹ Table of Contents

- [Overview](#overview)
- [Features](#features)
- [Quick Start](#quick-start)
- [Configuration Structure](#configuration-structure)
- [Agent System](#agent-system)
- [Context7 Integration](#context7-integration)
- [Commands & Workflows](#commands--workflows)
- [Advanced Features](#advanced-features)
- [Installation](#installation)
- [Contributing](#contributing)

## ğŸ¯ Overview

This repository contains a comprehensive Claude Code configuration designed for full-stack development with intelligent multi-agent orchestration. It includes automated task analysis, smart model selection, and integration with Context7 for real-time documentation access.

### Key Capabilities

- **ğŸ§  Intelligent Agent Orchestration**: 100+ specialized agents for every development need
- **ğŸ“š Context7 MCP Integration**: Real-time documentation for any library
- **ğŸ”„ Adaptive Model Selection**: Automatic selection between Haiku, Sonnet, and Opus
- **ğŸ“Š Learning System**: Continuous improvement from usage patterns
- **ğŸš€ Modern Stack Support**: Laravel, React, Next.js, TypeScript, Docker, and more

## âœ¨ Features

### Core Features

1. **Multi-Agent System**
   - Backend specialists (Laravel, PHP, TypeScript, Python)
   - Frontend experts (React, Vue, Next.js)
   - DevOps engineers (Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform)
   - Security auditors and penetration testers
   - AI/ML engineers

2. **Intelligent Orchestration**
   - Automatic task complexity analysis
   - Smart agent selection based on domain
   - Parallel and sequential execution patterns
   - Inter-agent communication protocols

3. **Context7 Integration**
   - Real-time library documentation
   - Version-specific information
   - Smart library resolution
   - Optimized token usage

4. **Advanced Workflows**
   - Full-stack feature development
   - Performance optimization
   - Security auditing
   - Deployment automation

## ğŸš€ Quick Start

### 1. Clone the Repository

```bash
git clone https://github.com/lushanoperera/claude-code.git
cd claude-code
```

### 2. Setup Environment

```bash
# Copy example environment file
cp .env.example .env

# Edit .env with your credentials
nano .env
```

### 3. Install Configuration

```bash
# Copy CLAUDE.md to your Claude directory
cp CLAUDE.md ~/.claude/CLAUDE.md

# Optional: Copy additional configurations
cp -r agents/ ~/.claude/agents/
cp -r templates/ ~/.claude/templates/
```

### 4. Verify Installation

```bash
# Test Claude Code with a simple command
claude "Hello, test the configuration"
```

## ğŸ“ Configuration Structure

```
claude-code-config/
â”œâ”€â”€ CLAUDE.md                 # Main configuration file
â”œâ”€â”€ agents.md                 # Complete agent catalog
â”œâ”€â”€ context7-integration.md   # Context7 MCP documentation
â”œâ”€â”€ workflows/               # Workflow templates
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ feature-development.yaml
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ performance-optimization.yaml
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ security-audit.yaml
â”œâ”€â”€ templates/              # Code templates
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ laravel/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ react/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ docker/
â””â”€â”€ scripts/               # Utility scripts
    â”œâ”€â”€ setup.sh
    â””â”€â”€ test-config.sh
```

## ğŸ¤– Agent System

### Available Agent Categories

#### Backend Development
- `laravel-specialist` - Laravel 10+ expert
- `php-pro` - Modern PHP 8.3+
- `backend-typescript-architect` - TypeScript with Bun
- `python-backend-engineer` - Python with uv tooling

#### Frontend Development
- `ui-engineer` - UI/UX implementation
- `react-specialist` - React 18+ with modern patterns
- `nextjs-developer` - Next.js 14+ with App Router
- `vue-expert` - Vue 3 Composition API

#### Full Stack
- `fullstack-developer` - End-to-end features
- `wordpress-expert` - WordPress customization

#### DevOps & Infrastructure
- `docker-specialist` - Containerization expert
- `kubernetes-specialist` - K8s orchestration
- `terraform-engineer` - Infrastructure as Code
- `devops-engineer` - CI/CD and automation

#### Security
- `security-engineer` - DevSecOps practices
- `penetration-tester` - Ethical hacking
- `security-auditor` - Compliance and audits

### Agent Selection Examples

```yaml
# Simple task - Single agent
Task: "Add email validation"
Agent: php-pro
Model: Haiku

# Medium complexity - Multiple agents
Task: "Implement authentication system"
Agents: [laravel-specialist, security-engineer]
Model: Sonnet

# Complex task - Orchestration
Task: "Build e-commerce platform"
Agents: [fullstack-developer, laravel-specialist, react-specialist, payment-integration]
Model: Opus
```

## ğŸ”Œ Context7 Integration

### Configuration

```yaml
endpoint: https://mcp.context7.com/mcp
priority: primary_documentation_source
```

### Usage Examples

```typescript
// Resolve library ID
resolve-library-id("react")
// Returns: /facebook/react

// Get documentation
get-library-docs("/facebook/react", {
  tokens: 10000,
  topic: "hooks"
})
```

### Supported Libraries

- **Frontend**: React, Vue, Angular, Svelte, Next.js
- **Backend**: Laravel, Express, NestJS, Django
- **Databases**: MongoDB, PostgreSQL, MySQL
- **Cloud**: AWS, Firebase, Supabase, Vercel

## ğŸ“ Commands & Workflows

### Quick Commands

```bash
# Agent selection
/agent laravel              # Activate Laravel specialist
/agent fullstack            # Activate full-stack developer
/orchestrate complex        # Start multi-agent orchestration

# Templates
/template feature           # Feature development template
/template optimize          # Performance optimization
/template security          # Security audit

# Context management
/context save project_name  # Save project context
/context load project_name  # Load project context

# Learning & optimization
/learn analyze             # Analyze patterns
/optimize suggest          # Get optimization suggestions
```

### Workflow Templates

#### Feature Development
```yaml
name: full-stack-feature-development
phases:
  1. Requirements analysis
  2. Backend API development
  3. Frontend implementation
  4. Integration testing
  5. Security review
```

#### Performance Optimization
```yaml
name: performance-optimization
phases:
  1. Performance profiling
  2. Database optimization
  3. Backend optimization
  4. Frontend optimization
  5. Infrastructure tuning
```

## ğŸš€ Advanced Features

### 1. Intelligent Model Selection

```typescript
interface ModelSelection {
  simple_tasks: 'haiku'        // 1-3 operations
  medium_tasks: 'sonnet'       // 4-7 operations
  complex_tasks: 'opus'        // 8+ operations
  critical_architecture: 'opus' // Always Opus
}
```

### 2. Learning System

The configuration includes an adaptive learning system that:
- Tracks success patterns
- Optimizes agent selection
- Improves over time
- Generates insights

### 3. Multi-Agent Orchestration

```typescript
// Parallel execution
const results = await Promise.all([
  agent1.execute(),
  agent2.execute(),
  agent3.execute()
])

// Sequential pipeline
const pipeline = agent1
  .then(agent2)
  .then(agent3)
  .execute()
```

### 4. Context Persistence

```json
{
  "project_context": {
    "tech_stack": ["Laravel", "React", "MySQL"],
    "architecture": "microservices",
    "deployment": "kubernetes",
    "team_size": 5
  }
}
```

## ğŸ“¦ Installation

### Prerequisites

- Claude Code CLI installed
- Git for version control
- Text editor for configuration

### Step-by-Step Installation

1. **Clone Repository**
   ```bash
   git clone https://github.com/lushanoperera/claude-code.git
   ```

2. **Configure Environment**
   ```bash
   cp .env.example .env
   # Add your credentials to .env
   ```

3. **Install Configuration**
   ```bash
   # Linux/Mac
   ./scripts/setup.sh
   
   # Windows
   scripts\setup.bat
   ```

4. **Verify Setup**
   ```bash
   ./scripts/test-config.sh
   ```

### Directory Structure After Installation

```
~/.claude/
â”œâ”€â”€ CLAUDE.md                  # Main configuration
â”œâ”€â”€ agents/                    # Agent specifications
â”œâ”€â”€ context/                   # Context persistence
â”œâ”€â”€ learning/                  # Learning data
â”œâ”€â”€ templates/                 # Code templates
â””â”€â”€ integrations/             # Service integrations
```

## ğŸ› ï¸ Customization

### Adding Custom Agents

```yaml
# agents/custom-agent.yaml
name: custom-specialist
expertise: "Your domain expertise"
tools: [tool1, tool2]
use_cases:
  - "Specific use case 1"
  - "Specific use case 2"
```

### Creating Workflow Templates

```yaml
# workflows/custom-workflow.yaml
name: custom-workflow
trigger: "pattern or command"
phases:
  - agent: specialist1
    tasks: [task1, task2]
  - agent: specialist2
    tasks: [task3, task4]
```

### Modifying Model Selection

```typescript
// Adjust complexity thresholds
const complexityThresholds = {
  simple: 3,    // Operations count
  medium: 7,    // Operations count
  complex: 10   // Operations count
}
```

## ğŸ“Š Metrics & Monitoring

### Tracked Metrics

- **Task Success Rate**: Completion percentage
- **Agent Performance**: Individual agent effectiveness
- **Model Accuracy**: Model selection accuracy
- **Time to Completion**: Average task duration
- **Cost Efficiency**: Token usage optimization

### Performance Dashboard

```bash
# View performance metrics
/dashboard show

# Get detailed analytics
/metrics summary

# Check system health
/health check
```

## ğŸ”’ Security Considerations

### Environment Variables

Never commit sensitive data. Use `.env` for:
- API keys
- Access tokens
- Personal information
- Service credentials

### Best Practices

1. Regular credential rotation
2. Use environment-specific configs
3. Implement access controls
4. Audit agent permissions
5. Monitor unusual activity

## ğŸ¤ Contributing

We welcome contributions! Please see our [Contributing Guide](CONTRIBUTING.md) for details.

### How to Contribute

1. Fork the repository
2. Create a feature branch
3. Make your changes
4. Test thoroughly
5. Submit a pull request

### Areas for Contribution

- New agent specifications
- Workflow templates
- Integration improvements
- Documentation updates
- Performance optimizations

## ğŸ“„ License

This project is licensed under the MIT License - see the [LICENSE](LICENSE) file for details.


This configuration builds upon excellent work from the open-source community:

### ğŸ¤– Agent Sources & Inspirations
- **[Agent OS](https://github.com/buildermethods/agent-os)** - Core orchestration patterns and multi-agent coordination
- **[Awesome Claude Code Agents](https://github.com/hesreallyhim/awesome-claude-code-agents)** - Curated agent collection and specializations  
- **[Agents Repository](https://github.com/wshobson/agents)** - Agent definitions and development patterns

### ğŸ› ï¸ Platform & Integration
- **[Anthropic](https://anthropic.com)** - Claude and Claude Code platform
- **[Context7](https://context7.com)** - MCP integration for real-time documentation
- **[MCP Protocol](https://modelcontextprotocol.io)** - Model Context Protocol specifications

### ğŸ’¡ Our Contributions
Building on these foundations, we've added:
- Intelligent agent orchestration with automatic model selection
- Bidirectional sync between Claude config and Git repository
- Advanced Context7 MCP integration with caching
- Comprehensive workflow templates and automation
- Developer experience enhancements with quick setup

See [CREDITS.md](CREDITS.md) for detailed attributions and licensing information.

## ğŸ“ Support

- **Issues**: [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/lushanoperera/claude-code/issues)
- **Discussions**: [GitHub Discussions](https://github.com/lushanoperera/claude-code/discussions)
- **Documentation**: [Wiki](https://github.com/lushanoperera/claude-code/wiki)

## ğŸ”„ Version History

- **v3.0** (2025-01-12): Current version with 100+ agents
- **v2.0**: Added Context7 integration
- **v1.0**: Initial release

---

**Built with â¤ï¸ for the Claude Code community**

*Last Updated: January 2025*

# Claude Code Configuration Repository

> ğŸ¤– **Advanced Claude Code configuration with intelligent agent orchestration, Context7 integration, and AI-driven development workflows**

## ğŸ“‹ Table of Contents

- [Overview](#overview)
- [Features](#features)
- [Quick Start](#quick-start)
- [Configuration Structure](#configuration-structure)
- [Agent System](#agent-system)
- [Context7 Integration](#context7-integration)
- [Commands & Workflows](#commands--workflows)
- [Advanced Features](#advanced-features)
- [Installation](#installation)
- [Contributing](#contributing)

## ğŸ¯ Overview

This repository contains a comprehensive Claude Code configuration designed for full-stack development with intelligent multi-agent orchestration. It includes automated task analysis, smart model selection, and integration with Context7 for real-time documentation access.

### Key Capabilities

- **ğŸ§  Intelligent Agent Orchestration**: 100+ specialized agents for every development need
- **ğŸ“š Context7 MCP Integration**: Real-time documentation for any library
- **ğŸ”„ Adaptive Model Selection**: Automatic selection between Haiku, Sonnet, and Opus
- **ğŸ“Š Learning System**: Continuous improvement from usage patterns
- **ğŸš€ Modern Stack Support**: Laravel, React, Next.js, TypeScript, Docker, and more

## âœ¨ Features

### Core Features

1. **Multi-Agent System**
   - Backend specialists (Laravel, PHP, TypeScript, Python)
   - Frontend experts (React, Vue, Next.js)
   - DevOps engineers (Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform)
   - Security auditors and penetration testers
   - AI/ML engineers

2. **Intelligent Orchestration**
   - Automatic task complexity analysis
   - Smart agent selection based on domain
   - Parallel and sequential execution patterns
   - Inter-agent communication protocols

3. **Context7 Integration**
   - Real-time library documentation
   - Version-specific information
   - Smart library resolution
   - Optimized token usage

4. **Advanced Workflows**
   - Full-stack feature development
   - Performance optimization
   - Security auditing
   - Deployment automation

## ğŸš€ Quick Start

### 1. Clone the Repository

```bash
git clone https://github.com/lushanoperera/claude-code.git
cd claude-code
```

### 2. Setup Environment

```bash
# Copy example environment file
cp .env.example .env

# Edit .env with your credentials
nano .env
```

### 3. Install Configuration

```bash
# Copy CLAUDE.md to your Claude directory
cp CLAUDE.md ~/.claude/CLAUDE.md

# Optional: Copy additional configurations
cp -r agents/ ~/.claude/agents/
cp -r templates/ ~/.claude/templates/
```

### 4. Verify Installation

```bash
# Test Claude Code with a simple command
claude "Hello, test the configuration"
```

## ğŸ“ Configuration Structure

```
claude-code-config/
â”œâ”€â”€ CLAUDE.md                 # Main configuration file
â”œâ”€â”€ agents.md                 # Complete agent catalog
â”œâ”€â”€ context7-integration.md   # Context7 MCP documentation
â”œâ”€â”€ workflows/               # Workflow templates
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ feature-development.yaml
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ performance-optimization.yaml
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ security-audit.yaml
â”œâ”€â”€ templates/              # Code templates
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ laravel/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ react/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ docker/
â””â”€â”€ scripts/               # Utility scripts
    â”œâ”€â”€ setup.sh
    â””â”€â”€ test-config.sh
```

## ğŸ¤– Agent System

### Available Agent Categories

#### Backend Development
- `laravel-specialist` - Laravel 10+ expert
- `php-pro` - Modern PHP 8.3+
- `backend-typescript-architect` - TypeScript with Bun
- `python-backend-engineer` - Python with uv tooling

#### Frontend Development
- `ui-engineer` - UI/UX implementation
- `react-specialist` - React 18+ with modern patterns
- `nextjs-developer` - Next.js 14+ with App Router
- `vue-expert` - Vue 3 Composition API

#### Full Stack
- `fullstack-developer` - End-to-end features
- `wordpress-expert` - WordPress customization

#### DevOps & Infrastructure
- `docker-specialist` - Containerization expert
- `kubernetes-specialist` - K8s orchestration
- `terraform-engineer` - Infrastructure as Code
- `devops-engineer` - CI/CD and automation

#### Security
- `security-engineer` - DevSecOps practices
- `penetration-tester` - Ethical hacking
- `security-auditor` - Compliance and audits

### Agent Selection Examples

```yaml
# Simple task - Single agent
Task: "Add email validation"
Agent: php-pro
Model: Haiku

# Medium complexity - Multiple agents
Task: "Implement authentication system"
Agents: [laravel-specialist, security-engineer]
Model: Sonnet

# Complex task - Orchestration
Task: "Build e-commerce platform"
Agents: [fullstack-developer, laravel-specialist, react-specialist, payment-integration]
Model: Opus
```
